intro: Haloxylon salicornicum, commonly known as the saltbush, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, often grayish-green leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Haloxylon salicornicum is well adapted to saline soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall. It plays an important role in stabilizing desert soils and providing forage for livestock.
